document_metadata.name: Implementation plan on promoting green consumption
document_metadata.description:
This plan aims to implement green and low-carbon principles in all consumption activities. It seeks to develop strategies helping to streamline the green consumption concept and promote high-quality development. It is formulated in accordance with the relevant requirements of the \"Carbon Peak Action Plan before 2030\" and notably focuses on \"green electricity\".

The document is  associated to another policy published through notice 53 and that stipulates that the government will lift restrictions to the purchase of \"new energy vehicles' (NEV) and will boost the installation of charging points across the country. NEV include electric, hydrogen, and low-emission gasoline passenger vehicles.

document_name: Implementation plan on promoting green consumption
document_description:
This plan aims to implement green and low-carbon principles in all consumption activities. It seeks to develop strategies helping to streamline the green consumption concept and promote high-quality development. It is formulated in accordance with the relevant requirements of the \"Carbon Peak Action Plan before 2030\" and notably focuses on \"green electricity\".

The document is  associated to another policy published through notice 53 and that stipulates that the government will lift restrictions to the purchase of \"new energy vehicles' (NEV) and will boost the installation of charging points across the country. NEV include electric, hydrogen, and low-emission gasoline passenger vehicles.

text: Implementation plan to promote green consumption

Green consumption is the consumption behavior of various consumer entities that implement green and low-carbon concepts in the entire process of consumption activities. In recent years, my country has made positive progress in promoting green consumption, and the concept of green consumption has gradually become popular. However, the demand for green consumption still needs to be stimulated and released. Waste and unreasonable consumption still exist in some areas. The long-term mechanism for promoting green consumption still needs to be improved. Green consumption The supporting role in high-quality economic development needs to be further improved. Promoting green consumption is a profound change in the field of consumption. Green concepts must be deeply integrated into the entire cycle, chain, and system of all areas of consumption, and comprehensively promote the green and low-carbon transformation and upgrading of consumption. This is important for implementing new development concepts, building a new development pattern, and promoting High-quality development and achieving the goal of carbon peak and carbon neutrality play an important role and are of great significance. This plan is formulated in accordance with the relevant requirements of the "Opinions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council on Completely, Accurately and Comprehensively Implementing the New Development Concept and Doing a Good Job in Carbon Neutrality to Peak Carbon" and the "Action Plan for Carbon Peaking Before 2030". 1. Overall requirements
(1) Guiding ideology.

Guided by Xi Jinping Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era, we will fully implement the spirit of the 19th National Congress of the Communist Party of China and all the 19th Plenary Sessions, thoroughly implement Xi Jinping Thought on Ecological Civilization, and implement the requirements of basing ourselves on the new development stage, implementing new development concepts, and building a new development pattern. , facing the goals of carbon peak and carbon neutrality, vigorously develop green consumption and enhance the national awareness of conservation,

Oppose luxury, waste and over-consumption, expand the supply and consumption of green and low-carbon products, improve the institutional policy system and institutional mechanisms that are conducive to promoting green consumption, promote the green transformation and upgrading of the consumption structure, and accelerate the formation of a simple, moderate, green, low-carbon, civilized and healthy life. Ways and consumption patterns provide important support for promoting high-quality development and creating high-quality life. (2) Working principles.

Adhere to systematic advancement. Comprehensively promote the green transformation of consumption in various fields such as food, clothing, housing, transportation, use, and tourism, coordinate the smooth connection between consumption and production, circulation, recycling, and reuse, and strengthen all-round support in technology, services, systems, and policies, etc. Achieve systematic conservation and loss reduction, energy conservation and carbon reduction.

Stick to key breakthroughs. Firmly grasp the goal orientation and problem orientation, focus on key areas of consumption, key products and main contradictions and outstanding problems, strengthen reform and innovation, overcome difficulties and pilot demonstrations, and encourage qualified regions and industries to experiment and explore experience first. Adhere to social co-governance. Give full play to the role of the market mechanism, give better play to the role of the government, focus on mobilizing the enthusiasm, initiative and creativity of all aspects of society, and strive to form a co-governance pattern in which the government vigorously promotes, enterprises actively self-discipline, the society comprehensively collaborates, and the public participates extensively, so as to gather synergy and form a comprehensive A good trend of social participation.

Adhere to both incentives and constraints. Closely adhere to the green and low-carbon goals, deepen and improve relevant laws, standards, statistics and other institutional systems in the consumption field, optimize and innovate fiscal, financial, price, credit, supervision and other policy measures to form an effective incentive and restraint mechanism. (3) Main objectives. By 2025, the concept of green consumption will be deeply rooted in the hearts of the people, luxury and waste will be effectively curbed, the market share of green and low-carbon products will increase significantly, and the green transformation of consumption in key areas will achieve remarkable results.
Effective results have been achieved, green consumption methods have been widely promoted, and a green, low-carbon and circular consumption system has been initially formed.

By 2030, green consumption methods will become a conscious choice of the public, green and low-carbon products will become the mainstream of the market, green and low-carbon consumption development models in key areas will be basically formed, and green consumption system policy systems and institutional mechanisms will be basically sound.
2. Comprehensively promote the green transformation of consumption in key areas

(4) Accelerate the improvement of the level of green food consumption. Improve the production, storage, transportation, and processing standards of agricultural products such as grains, vegetables, and fruits, strengthen conservation and loss management, and improve the processing conversion rate. Vigorously promote green organic food and agricultural products. Guide consumers to establish a civilized and healthy concept of food consumption, purchase, store, prepare food, order and dine reasonably and appropriately. Establish and improve relevant standards and service specifications for the catering industry, encourage the development of new models such as "planting base + central kitchen", urge catering companies and catering takeout platforms to implement anti-food waste laws, regulations and requirements, and promote catering to continue to be green, healthy and safe and scale, standardization, and standardized development. Strengthen supervision of food producers and operators’ anti-food waste situations. Promote various agencies, enterprises, institutions, schools, etc. to establish and improve canteen dining management systems and formulate and implement measures to prevent food waste. Strengthen meal management for receptions, meetings, training and other activities to eliminate meal waste, and government agencies and institutions must take the lead in implementation. Carry out in-depth food conservation actions such as "CD-ROM". Promote the recycling, disposal and resource utilization of food waste. Strengthen scientific research and platform support in the field of green food consumption. Integrate requirements such as food conservation and loss reduction, and civilized dining tables into citizen covenants, village rules and regulations, industry norms, etc. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Education, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, the Ministry of Commerce, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council, the State Administration for Market Regulation, the State Grain and Reserves Administration and other departments according to their duties
Responsible for division of responsibilities)

(5) Encourage the promotion of green clothing consumption. Promote the application of equipment and technologies such as green fiber preparation, high-efficiency and energy-saving printing and dyeing, and waste fiber recycling, increase the proportion of green fibers such as recycled chemical fibers, and provide more clothing that meets green and low-carbon requirements. Promote more procurement by various agencies, enterprises, institutions, schools, etc. to have green and low-carbon related certifications

Logo uniforms, school uniforms. Consumers are encouraged to consume rationally and purchase clothing reasonably and appropriately according to actual needs. Standardize the public welfare donation of used clothes, and encourage enterprises and residents to donate appropriate used clothes to needy people in need through charitable organizations in accordance with the law. Encourage units, communities, clothing stores, etc. to rationally arrange used clothing recycling points and strengthen reuse. Support the construction of demonstration bases for comprehensive utilization of waste textiles and clothing. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Education, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the Ministry of Commerce, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(6) Actively promote green residential consumption. Accelerate the development of green construction. Promote the large-scale development of green buildings and low-carbon buildings, and incorporate energy conservation and environmental protection requirements into the renovation of old communities. Promote energy-saving renovation of rural houses and construction of green rural houses. Promote the construction and renovation of clean heating facilities according to local conditions. Comprehensively promote green and low-carbon building materials, promote the recycling of building materials, and encourage qualified areas to carry out green and low-carbon building materials to the countryside. Vigorously develop green home decoration. Encourage the use of energy-saving lamps, energy-saving and environmentally friendly stoves, water-saving toilets and other energy-saving and water-saving products. Promote reasonable control of indoor temperature, brightness and use of electrical equipment. Continue to promote clean heating in rural areas, improve the level of rural energy electrification, and accelerate the application of renewable energy sources such as biomass and solar energy in rural life. (National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, Ministry of Natural Resources, Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, State Administration for Market Regulation, State-4 ––
The Energy Bureau and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(7) Vigorously develop green transportation consumption. Vigorously promote new energy vehicles, gradually remove restrictions on the purchase of new energy vehicles in various places, promote the implementation of support policies such as exemption from restrictions and right of way, strengthen the construction of supporting infrastructure such as charging and swapping, new energy storage, and hydrogenation, and actively promote the development of LNG for vehicles and ships. Promote the implementation of pilot projects for the application of battery swap modes for new energy vehicles and carry out demonstration applications of fuel cell vehicles in an orderly manner. We will carry out in-depth activities to bring new energy vehicles to the countryside, encourage automobile companies to develop and promote high-quality, low-cost, advanced and applicable new energy vehicles that are suitable for the travel needs of rural residents, and promote and improve the rural operation and maintenance service system. Reasonably guide consumers to purchase lightweight, compact, and low-emission passenger cars. Vigorously promote the electrification of vehicles in the public sector and increase the proportion of new energy vehicle applications in urban public transportation, taxis (including online ride-hailing), sanitation, urban logistics and distribution, postal express delivery, civil aviation airports, and official business areas of party and government agencies. We will further carry out the construction of public transportation cities, create an efficient, fast and comfortable public transportation service system, and further increase the proportion of urban buses, trams and rail transportation. Encourage the construction of pedestrian-friendly cities and strengthen the construction of urban slow-traffic systems such as pedestrian trails and bicycle lanes. Encourage the standardized development of shared bicycles. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation, the National Energy Administration, the State Post Bureau and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(8) Comprehensively promote the consumption of green supplies. Strengthen the quality and brand building of green and low-carbon products. Encourage and guide consumers to replace or purchase new household products such as green energy-saving appliances and environmentally friendly furniture. Vigorously promote smart home appliances, reduce unnecessary energy consumption, and participate in power grid peak regulation by optimizing switching times and peak-staggered start and stop. Promote e-commerce platforms and distribution companies such as shopping malls and supermarkets to set up green and low-carbon product sales areas, and set up green and low-carbon products in large-scale promotional activities

Special session to actively promote green and low-carbon products. Encourage qualified regions to carry out energy-saving home appliances and smart home appliances to the countryside. Vigorously develop trade in high-quality, high-tech, high value-added green and low-carbon products, and actively expand the import of green and low-carbon products. Promote the management of excessive packaging, encourage producers and operators to comply with mandatory standards that restrict excessive packaging of goods, implement subtractive color printing, and gradually realize green, reduction and recycling of commodity packaging. Establish and improve a reporting system for the use and recycling of disposable plastic products, and supervise and guide retail establishments, e-commerce platform companies, express delivery companies, and takeout companies to implement their main responsibilities. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation, the State Post Bureau and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(9) Guide green consumption in the cultural and tourism fields in an orderly manner. Develop green and low-carbon exhibition guidelines for large-scale events, guide the priority use of green and environmentally friendly booths, exhibition tools and exhibition equipment, strengthen the application of energy-saving technologies such as green lighting in the field of lighting and stage design, and significantly reduce the pollution and consumption of sound, light, electricity and items at event sites. Improve the transportation conditions for airports, stations, docks and other tourist gathering areas and key scenic spots and scenic spots, promote the construction of dedicated cycling lines and hiking trails, and encourage and guide tourists to adopt low-carbon travel methods such as walking, bicycles and public transportation. Integrate concepts such as green design, energy-saving management, and green services into scenic area operations to reduce resource and environmental consumption and achieve efficient and recycling of scenic area resources. Promote the healthy development of rural tourism consumption, strictly limit the occupation and over-exploitation of cultivated land and wetlands in forest areas, and protect natural carbon sinks. Formulate and publish green tourism consumption conventions or guidelines, strengthen public welfare publicity, and standardize and guide scenic spots, travel agencies, tourists, etc. to practice green tourism consumption. (National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Natural Resources, Ministry of Ecology and Environment, Ministry of Transport, Ministry of Commerce, Ministry of Culture and Tourism and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(10) Further stimulate the green power consumption potential of the whole society. Implement that new renewable energy and raw material energy are not included in the total energy consumption control requirements, and coordinate the promotion of green power trading and green certificate trading. Guide users to sign green power trading contracts and list them separately in mid- and long-term trading contracts. Encourage industry leading enterprises, large state-owned enterprises, multinational companies, etc. to consume green electricity, play a demonstration and leading role, and promote regions with more export-oriented enterprises and strong economic affordability to gradually increase the proportion of green electricity consumption. Strengthen the use of energy-intensive enterprises
Rigid constraints on green electricity, various localities can formulate power consumption regulations for high-energy-consuming enterprises based on actual conditions.

The lowest proportion of green electricity in the fee. All localities should organize power grid enterprises to regularly sort out and publish the distribution of local green power periods, and guide users to consume more green power in an orderly manner. Within the scope permitted by the grid's guaranteed supply capacity, users with a higher proportion of green electricity consumption will be given priority when implementing demand-side management. Establish a linkage mechanism between green power trading and renewable energy consumption responsibility weights, and market-oriented users can complete the renewable energy consumption responsibility weights by purchasing green power or green certificates. Strengthen the connection with carbon emission rights trading, combine with the revision and improvement of technical specifications for accounting reports of relevant industries in the national carbon market, and study the feasibility of deducting green power-related carbon emissions in emissions accounting. Continue to promote the innovative development of smart photovoltaics, vigorously promote the application of photovoltaics in buildings, and accelerate the increase in the proportion of green electricity consumption among residents. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council, the National Energy Administration and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)
(11) Vigorously promote the green transformation of consumption in public institutions. Promote state agencies and affairs

Public institutions such as business units and organizations take the lead in purchasing and using new energy vehicles, and new and existing parking lots are equipped with electric vehicle charging facilities or reserved conditions for the installation of charging facilities. Actively promote green office, improve the efficiency of office equipment and asset use, encourage paperless office and dual

Print on the surface and encourage the use of recycled products. Strictly implement the regulations on thrift and anti-waste by party and government agencies, ensure standardized expenditures for various official activities, increase the proportion of video conferences, and strictly manage official vehicles. Encourage and promote civilized and frugal activities. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the State Council and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities) 3. Strengthen green consumption technology and service support (12) Promote the application of advanced green and low-carbon technologies. Guide enterprises to improve the level of green innovation, actively develop and introduce advanced and applicable green and low-carbon technologies, vigorously promote green design and green manufacturing, produce more new products and equipment that meet green and low-carbon requirements, are ecologically friendly and have broad application prospects, and expand Supply of green and low-carbon products. Promote the production and use of products with low volatile organic compound content. Strengthen the research, development, promotion and transformation and application of low-carbon, zero-carbon and carbon-negative technologies, smart technologies, digital technologies, etc., and improve catering, housing, transportation, logistics and

The level of intelligence and operational efficiency in commodity production and other fields. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Science and Technology, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Post Bureau and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(13) Promote the smooth connection of the entire chain of production, supply and marketing. Promote a full life cycle green supply chain system covering all upstream, mid-stream and downstream entities and all links of production, supply and marketing, promote green innovation and transformation such as e-commerce and trade circulation, drive the green transformation of the production fields of upstream suppliers and service providers, and encourage downstream enterprises , merchants and residents consciously carry out green purchasing, stimulating the endogenous motivation of the whole society to produce and consume green and low-carbon products and services. Encourage state-owned enterprises to take the lead in promoting the transformation of green supply chains. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Commerce, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)
(14) Accelerate the development of green logistics and distribution. Actively promote green express packaging, citing -8-

Conductive merchants and express delivery companies give priority to purchasing and using express packaging products that have obtained green certification to promote the green transformation of express packaging. Encourage enterprises to use integrated packaging of goods and logistics, use more original boxes for shipment, and significantly reduce secondary packaging in logistics links. Promote the application of new express packaging products such as low-weight and high-strength express packaging cartons, glue-free cartons, and recyclable delivery boxes, and encourage the reduction of filler use through packaging structure optimization. Accelerate the construction of urban and rural logistics distribution systems and public express delivery terminal facilities, improve rural distribution networks, innovate green, low-carbon, intensive and efficient distribution models, and vigorously develop centralized distribution, joint distribution, and night delivery. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation, the State Post Bureau and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(15) Expand the sharing and utilization of idle resources and second-hand trading channels. Orderly develop the sharing economy in travel, accommodation, freight and other fields, and encourage the sharing and exchange of idle items. Actively develop the second-hand car distribution business, promote the implementation of the comprehensive cancellation of second-hand car relocation restrictions, and further expand the circulation of second-hand cars. Actively develop second-hand transactions such as home appliances, consumer electronics and clothing to optimize the trading environment. Allow qualified areas to develop flea markets in an orderly manner on idle land around communities or designated specific spaces, encourage communities to regularly organize second-hand commodity trading activities, and promote the transaction and circulation of idle items in households within the jurisdiction. Standardize the online trading of second-hand goods, strengthen the construction of credit and supervision systems, and improve the rules for resolving transaction disputes. Encourage the development of supporting facilities such as second-hand testing centers and third-party evaluation laboratories. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Public Security, the Ministry of Natural Resources, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities) (16) Establish a waste material recycling system. Incorporate waste material recycling facilities, scrapped motor vehicle recycling and dismantling business sites, etc. into relevant plans to ensure reasonable land use needs.

According to the requirements, we should coordinate and promote the "integration of two networks" of waste material recycling outlets and domestic waste classification outlets, and rationally layout and standardize the construction of recycling network systems. Relax the restrictions on waste material recycling vehicles entering cities and residential areas and standardize management to ensure reasonable rights of way. Actively promote the "Internet + recycling" model. Strengthen the recycling and processing of durable consumer goods such as used household appliances and consumer electronics, and encourage household appliance manufacturers to carry out recycling target responsibility systems. Improve rural recycling networks according to local conditions and promote the integrated development of urban and rural waste material recycling systems. Promote the large-scale, standardized and clean utilization of renewable resources and promote the clustered development of renewable resource industries. Strengthen the standardized management and environmental supervision of enterprises that dismantle and utilize waste electrical and electronic products, scrapped motor vehicles, scrapped ships, scrap lead-acid batteries, etc., and investigate and deal with violations of laws and regulations in accordance with the law. Steadily advance the construction of "waste-free cities". (National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, Ministry of Public Security, Ministry of Natural Resources, Ministry of Ecology and Environment, Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Ministry of Commerce and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

4. Establish and improve the green consumption system guarantee system (17) Accelerate the improvement of the legal system. Research and demonstrate laws and regulations related to green consumption, advocate following the three principles of reduction, reuse, and resource utilization, clearly define the requirements for procurement, manufacturing, circulation, use, recycling, and processing surrounding green consumption, and clarify the requirements for governments and enterprises , social organizations, consumers and other subjects’ responsibilities and obligations. Promote the revision of the "Tendering and Bidding Law" and the "Government Procurement Law" and improve green procurement policies. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Justice, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Commerce and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(18) Optimize and improve the standard certification system. Further improve and strengthen the standards, certification, and labeling systems for green and low-carbon products and services, strengthen the connection with international standards, and vigorously improve - 10-

Improve market recognition and quality benefits of green label products and green services. Improve the green energy consumption certification and labeling system to guide and increase the proportion of green energy in terminal energy consumption in residential, transportation, public institutions and other terminal energy consumption. Improve the green design and green manufacturing standard system, accelerate the update and upgrade of energy-saving standards, increase the energy consumption limit requirements for key products, and vigorously eliminate low-energy-efficiency products. Formulate greenhouse gas emission standards for key industries and products, and explore the establishment of full life cycle carbon footprint standards for key products. Formulate and revise limits for volatile organic compounds in industrial raw and auxiliary materials and consumer products. Improve and implement "front-runner" systems and standards such as water efficiency, and lead the continuous improvement of green products and services. (National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, Ministry of Ecology and Environment, Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Ministry of Commerce, State Administration for Market Regulation, National Energy Administration and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(19) Explore and establish a statistical monitoring and evaluation system. Explore the establishment of a green consumption statistical system and strengthen data collection, statistical monitoring, analysis and prediction of green consumption. Research and establish a comprehensive and classified green consumption index and evaluation index system to scientifically evaluate green consumption levels and development changes in different regions and fields. (National Development and Reform Commission, National Bureau of Statistics and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(20) Promote the establishment of a green consumption information platform. Explore the establishment of a specialized green consumption guidance agency and a national unified green consumption information platform, coordinate and guide and regularly publish green and low-carbon product lists and purchasing guides, improve the transparency of green and low-carbon product production and consumption, and guide and facilitate institutions, consumers, etc. Selection and purchasing. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities) 5. Improve green consumption incentive and restraint policies (21) Enhance the accuracy of financial support. Improve government green procurement standards and increase

Strengthen the procurement of green and low-carbon products, expand the scope of green and low-carbon product procurement, and increase the proportion of green and low-carbon products in government procurement. Implement and improve preferential tax policies for comprehensive utilization of resources, and better leverage the role of taxation in promoting the green and low-carbon development of market entities. Encourage qualified regions to provide appropriate subsidies or loan discounts for consumer goods such as smart home appliances, green building materials, energy-saving and low-carbon products. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration of Taxation and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(22) Increase financial support. Guide banking and insurance institutions to standardize the development of green consumer financial services, promote the development of green business of consumer finance companies, provide financial services to enterprises and individuals who produce, sell, and purchase green and low-carbon products, and improve the coverage and convenience of financial services. Steadily expand the scale of green bond issuance, encourage financial institutions and non-financial enterprises to issue green bonds, and better provide service support for the certification and promotion of green and low-carbon technology products. Encourage social capital to establish green consumption-related funds in a market-oriented manner. Encourage the development of new energy vehicle insurance products and encourage insurance companies to provide insurance coverage for green buildings. (National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Finance, People's Bank of China, China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission, China Securities Regulatory Commission and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(23) Give full play to the role of the price mechanism. Further improve the tiered price system for residential water, electricity and gas consumption. Improve the time-of-use electricity price policy, effectively widen the peak-to-valley price difference and floating range, and guide users to store energy and use electricity in off-peak periods. Gradually expand the cost gradient between new energy vehicles and traditional fuel vehicles. Improve the urban public transportation price formation mechanism, comprehensively consider urban carrying capacity, enterprise operating costs and transportation supply and demand conditions, establish a multi-level and differentiated price system, and enhance the attractiveness of public transportation. Explore and implement parking charging policies that will help alleviate urban traffic congestion and effectively promote the priority development of public transportation. Jianjian-12-

The kitchen waste measurement and charging mechanism for all catering enterprises will gradually implement a progressive price increase for exceeding the quota. Establish and improve the charging system for urban domestic waste treatment, and gradually implement classified pricing and metered charging. Encourage qualified places to establish rural domestic sewage and domestic garbage treatment charging systems. (The National Development and Reform Commission takes the lead, and the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, the National Energy Administration and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(24) Promote more market-oriented incentives. Explore and implement a national green consumption points system, encourage local governments to establish local green consumption point systems based on actual conditions, and encourage green consumption through exchanges for goods, discounts, etc. Encourage various sales platforms to formulate incentives for the consumption of green and low-carbon products, and encourage green consumption through the issuance of green consumption coupons, green points, direct subsidies, price reductions and interest rates. Encourage industry associations, platform companies, manufacturing companies, circulation companies, etc. to jointly launch green consumption action plans and launch more green and low-carbon products and green consumption scenarios. Market entities are encouraged to recycle used items through trade-in, mortgage payments, etc. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(25) Strengthen penalties and restrictions on violations of laws and regulations. Develop quality and safety responsibility guarantees for green and low-carbon products, severely crack down on false labeling of green and low-carbon products, and include relevant administrative penalties and other information into the national credit information sharing platform and the national enterprise credit information disclosure system. Strictly punish the production and sales of products and equipment included in the elimination list in accordance with the law. Improve the standards for online live broadcasts such as short video live broadcasts and live broadcasts with goods, further standardize live broadcast behaviors, severely crack down on illegal and bad behaviors such as false advertising, false propaganda, and data traffic falsification, prohibit deceiving and misleading consumers, and curb inducing consumers to over-consume.

Fees and promote a rational and healthy live broadcast culture. (The Cyberspace Administration of China, the National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, the Ministry of Commerce, the State Administration for Market Regulation, the State Administration of Radio, Film and Television and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)
6. Organization and implementation

(26) Strengthen organizational leadership. Strengthen the party's overall leadership throughout all aspects and the entire process of promoting green consumption. All regions must effectively assume the main responsibilities, pay close attention to implementation based on actual conditions, and constantly improve the institutional mechanisms and policy support systems. All relevant departments should actively strengthen coordination and cooperation according to their functional division of labor, strive to form policy and work synergies, and solidly advance various tasks. The National Development and Reform Commission should strengthen overall coordination, supervision and guidance, give full play to the role of the inter-ministerial joint meeting system for improving consumption promotion systems and mechanisms, and work with relevant departments to coordinate and promote the organization and implementation of this plan. (The National Development and Reform Commission and other relevant departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(27) Carry out pilot demonstrations. Organize and carry out pilot and demonstration work to promote green consumption, encourage qualified key regions, key industries, and key enterprises to take the lead in trials and actively explore effective models and useful experiences. Extensively carry out actions such as creating conservation-oriented institutions, green families, green communities, and green travel. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, the Ministry of Transport, the State Administration of Management, the Central Administration Bureau, the All-China Women's Federation and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)

(28) Strengthen publicity and education. Carry forward the excellent traditional Chinese culture of diligence and thrift, cultivate national awareness and habits of green consumption, and build a solid social and cultural foundation for green consumption. Promote green consumption publicity and education into institutions, schools, enterprises, communities, rural areas and families, and guide employees, students and residents to save food, water, electricity and green travel - 14 -

Green consumption practices such as green shopping. Comprehensively use newspapers, television, radio, the Internet, Weibo, WeChat and other media to explore forms that are popular with the masses, increase public welfare publicity on green consumption, and provide timely, accurate and vivid policy publicity and interpretation to the public and enterprises. Effectively improve policy awareness. (Propaganda Department of the Central Committee, National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Civil Affairs, Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, Ministry of Commerce, State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council, State Administration for Market Regulation, State Administration of Radio, Film and Television, State Administration of China, Central Administration Bureau, All-China Federation of Trade Unions, All-China Women's Federation, etc. Departments are responsible according to their division of responsibilities)

(29) Pay attention to the promotion of experience. Timely summarize and promote the good experiences and practices of relevant departments and market entities in various regions in promoting green consumption, and explore the preparation of an annual report on green consumption development. Continue to carry out activities such as National Energy Conservation Week, National Low Carbon Day, and the Sixth Five-Year Plan Environment Day, and encourage local governments and social institutions to organize forums, exhibitions and other activities with the theme of green consumption to facilitate discussions on green consumption concepts, experiences, policies, etc. , exchange and dissemination, and promote the promotion and use of green and low-carbon products and services. (The National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Ecology and Environment and other departments are responsible according to the division of responsibilities)
